details:
This survey is to learn about your views on the brain and brain health. 
Brain health is about your ability to remember, learn, plan, concentrate, and handle challenges. It is also about your ability to be mentally and emotionally in balance.  Simply said, brain health is about making the most of your brain and taking care of it (Source: National Institutes of Health, USA).


Your participation in this survey is voluntary and all your answers will be anonymous. The survey takes approximately 15 minutes to complete. Questions that must be answered are marked with a purple asterisk (*). NB! Your answers will not be registered until you press "send" after the last questions at the end of the survey!
INFORMED CONSENT

details.answer_option: I am above 18 years of age and I consent to the use of these data for research

details:
SURVEY BACKGROUND


This research is not for profit and is conducted by the Lifebrain consortium in collaboration with the Norwegian Brain Council, the German Brain Council, the Belgian Brain Council, The National University of Ostroh Academy, Brain Foundation Netherlands, the Women’s Brain Project and The Swedish Brain Foundation.

Lifebrain is funded by the European Union Horizon 2020 program.

You can read more about the survey here. If you have any questions, please contact lifebrainoslo@gmail.com.

Click on the "Next page" button to continue.

details: Please specify anything else you do for your brain health:

7. You can easily take tests to check your blood pressure or cholesterol level and learn whether you are at risk of developing a heart disease. If the tests show that you are at risk, you may want to reduce your risk, for instance, by changing diet. 

Imagine that similar tests could be done to establish your risk of developing a brain disease.

Do you think a brain health test should be….

details.answer_option: Subsidized by social security (via the GP)
Offered online with direct access to the results

details: Please specify "Other".
8. Imagine a simple brain health test to learn about risk of developing a brain disease. Would you wish to take such a test?
9a. Why would you take a brain health test?

details.answer_option: To get information about my cognitive and mental health
To determine my risk of developing a brain disease
To respond if I am at risk, e.g. change my lifestyle, seek counselling, or start treatment
To prepare myself for the future (e.g. inform my family about the risk)

details: Please specify "Other motivation".
9b. Would you take a test even if it provides information about a disease that cannot be prevented or treated?
9c. Why would you NOT take a brain health test?

details.answer_option: I do not want to worry about something that may not happen
I do not want to know about a disease that cannot be prevented or treated
I would be frightened by the result
There is nothing I can do for my brain health anyway

details: Please specify "Other reason".

12. What would motivate you to change lifestyle to improve brain health?

details.answer_option: If I noticed problems with my brain health (e.g. my memory worsened)
If I had been diagnosed with a brain disorder
If the lifestyle changes were fun and enjoyable
If the lifestyle changes were affordable
If my relatives or friends developed a brain disorder
If I received personal advice about what to do (e.g. from my doctor)
If I had the support of friends/family
If it were known that the lifestyle changes are beneficial

details: Please specify "Other".
13. What would prevent you from changing your lifestyle to improve brain health?

details.answer_option: Lack of information about what to do
If I had to give up activities I like
If I had to take up activities that I do not enjoy
If I had to make changes by myself/alone
If I cannot be sure that the changes help
I feel no need to do anything

details: Please specify "Other".
14. Imagine you decide to change your lifestyle to maintain or improve your brain health. What kind of assistance would you need?

details.answer_option: Advice from my GP or from a specialist, e.g. a nutritionist or a personal trainer
Support from family members and/or friends
Group support, e.g. a walking group
A mobile app to help with brain and physical training
Regular monitoring to review the effect of lifestyle changes
Other kind of assistance, please specify:

details: Please specify "Other kind of assistance".
